column8: PUTRAJAYA: The Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) has given the individual who is alleged to have offered the Johor Ruler Sultan Ibrahim Ibni Almarhum Sultan Iskandar a RM2mil bribe until midnight Thursday to come forward. Failing which, his identity will be revealed, MACC deputy chief commissioner (operations) Datuk Azam Baki (pic) said."We know he has gone into hiding but he is still in Malaysia."We urge him to cooperate and turn up at the MACC headquarters today," Azam said Thursday. He said the MACC has also sought cooperation from the Immigration Department to bar the man from leaving the country.Not wanting to divulge much information on the individual as yet, Azam only described the man "as being bald and a Chinese".Last Saturday, Sultan Ibrahim wrote on his official Facebook page that he was offered RM2mil to suggest the person's name to the Chief Secretary of Malaysia for a "Tan Sri" title.He said he was ready to reveal information pertaining to those trying to buy him over to the MACC and wanted the matter to be investigated.On Monday, the Johor Ruler granted an audience to MACC chief Datuk Dzulkifli Ahmad following his allegations.Read more at http://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2017...q6aQWbYJHxBj.99
